scene_metadata.title: Actions as Questions
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: truth through action rather than words

panels.message: The door created by seeking it

dialogue.text: Ask again. But not with your words. With your actions. Make something. Undo something. Be radically honest in a space where you usually lie. That might bring the door back faster than any ceremony.

psychological_notes: The architect reveals that the deepest questions are asked through action, not language. Making and unmaking become forms of inquiry. Radical honesty in unexpected places creates the psychological conditions for thresholds to appear. This is about changing patterns, not performing rituals.
philosophical_underpinning: Truth emerges through embodied action more readily than abstract thought
therapeutic_direction: Encouraging experiential investigation over intellectual analysis
